title: Resource-bounded measure
summary: Lutz's resource-bounded measure is a generalisation of Lebesgue measure to complexity classes. It was originally developed by Jack Lutz. Just as Lebesgue measure gives a method to quantify the size of subsets of the Euclidean space R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} , resource bounded measure gives a method to classify the size of subsets of complexity classes.
